intro: Pediomelum goughae, commonly known as Gough's pediomelum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow-orange blooms. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
